definition: to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
to drape over one's shoulders/to open/to unroll/to split open/to spread out
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]

sentences.english: At last, we have heard the crow, and happily home along with twinkling stars.
sentences.chinese: 终于子时鸡叫，我们披星戴月回家了。

sentences.english: The caravan traveled by night and day in order to reach their destination on time.
sentences.chinese: 那支商队披星戴月赶路，以便按时到达目的地。

sentences.english: The trackmen work very hard from morning till dusk.
sentences.chinese: 巡道工人披星戴月地执行任务。

sentences.english: We know there're many difficulties, it's only for a beautiful tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道很苦，披星戴月为的是拥有美好的明天。

sentences.english: Travel day and night, a road information to tell my family ' I'm safe '.
sentences.chinese: 披星戴月，一路用信息告诉家人‘我很平安’。

definition: see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
variant of 披星戴月[pi1 xing1 dai4 yue4]
to make nothing of hardships
to spare no effort
to travel over land and water (idiom)
see 披星戴月[pi1 xing1 dai4 yue4]
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
lit. to comb one's hair in the wind and wash it in the rain (idiom)/fig. to work in the open regardless of the weather
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
laborious
